qas.question: How long ago did the Ordovician period begin?
Which event precipitated the Ordovician period?
What was the name of the large southernmost continent during the Ordovician?
Which ocean decreased in size with the movement of Baltica in the Ordovician?
What continent fractured off Gondwana in the direction of Laurentia?
What was the name of the period that ended with a major extinction event?
What extinction event occured at the end of the Ordocician Period?
When was the extinction event that ended the Ordovician period?
What contenent formed several southern coninents during the Ordovician?
What continent drifted from the South Pole to the equator?

context: <b5_0>The Ordovician Period<b5_0/> started at a major extinction event called <a1_0><b6_0>the Cambrian-Ordovician extinction<b6_0/><a1_0/> events some time about <a0_0><b7_0>485.4 ± 1.9 Ma<b7_0/>.<a0_0/> During the Ordovician the southern continents were collected into a single continent called <a2_0>Gondwana<a2_0/>. <b8_0><b9_0>Gondwana<b9_0/><b8_0/> started the period in the equatorial latitudes and, as the period progressed, drifted toward the South Pole. Early in the Ordovician the continents Laurentia, Siberia and Baltica were still independent continents (since the break-up of the supercontinent Pannotia earlier), but Baltica began to move toward Laurentia later in the period, causing the <a3_0>Iapetus Ocean<a3_0/> to shrink between them. Also, <a4_0>Avalonia<a4_0/> broke free from Gondwana and began to head north toward Laurentia. The Rheic Ocean was formed as a result of this. By the end of the period, Gondwana had neared or approached the pole and was largely glaciated.
